column1: This MS&L Railway Company site seems likely to have been part of its Sheffield and South Yorkshire Navigation system of canals and waterways, which came under MS&LR control in 1864.
MS&LR were forced to divest these canals and waterways in 1895.
MS&LR owned the Dearne and Dove Canal, which has a branch that runs to Worsborough, where it ends at Worsborough Reservoir.

The rainfall sheets give no details of the gauge location, a location by the reservoir matches the 225ft elevation given on the early rainfall sheets - the canal basin at Worsborough is signficantly lower and so not such a good candidate.
The Reservoir Cottage has been used for the grid reference given above.
There may have been a move of the gauge to a nearby railway site in the mid-1890s, when MS&LR sold the canal. (Other related MS&LR sites show a change of elevation around this time.)
